title: ROKRAT
descrption: ROKRAT is a cloud-based remote access tool (RAT) used by APT37. This software has been used to target victims in South Korea. APT37 used ROKRAT during several campaigns in 2016 through 2018. [1] [2]

references.title: Mercer, W., Rascagneres, P. (2017, April 03). Introducing ROKRAT. Retrieved May 21, 2018.
Mercer, W., Rascagneres, P. (2018, January 16). Korea In The Crosshairs. Retrieved May 21, 2018.
Mercer, W., Rascagneres, P. (2017, November 28). ROKRAT Reloaded. Retrieved May 21, 2018.
GReAT. (2019, May 13). ScarCruft continues to evolve, introduces Bluetooth harvester. Retrieved June 4, 2019.

related.Name: Audio Capture
related.Use: ROKRAT has a audio capture and eavesdropping module.[4]

related.Name: Credential Dumping
related.Use: ROKRAT steals credentials stored in Web browsers by querying the sqlite database and leveraging the Windows Vault mechanism.[2]

related.Name: Exfiltration Over Command and Control Channel
related.Use: ROKRAT sends collected files back over same C2 channel.[1]

related.Name: File and Directory Discovery
related.Use: ROKRAT has the ability to gather a list of files and directories on the infected system. [4]

related.Name: Input Capture
related.Use: ROKRAT uses a keylogger to capture keystrokes and location of where the user is typing.[1]

related.Name: Process Discovery
related.Use: ROKRAT lists the current running processes on the system.[1]

related.Name: Query Registry
related.Use: ROKRAT accesses the HKLM\System\CurrentControlSet\Services\mssmbios\Data\SMBiosData Registry key to obtain the System manufacturer value to identify the machine type.[2]

related.Name: Remote File Copy
related.Use: ROKRAT retrieves additional malicious payloads from the C2 server.[1]

related.Name: Screen Capture
related.Use: ROKRAT captures screenshots of the infected system.[1][3][4]

related.Name: Standard Application Layer Protocol
related.Use: ROKRAT use HTTPS for all command and control communication methods.[1]

related.Name: System Information Discovery
related.Use: ROKRAT gathers the computer name and checks the OS version to ensure it doesn’t run on a Windows XP or Windows Server 2003 systems.[1][3][4]

related.Name: Web Service
related.Use: ROKRAT leverages legitimate social networking sites and cloud platforms (Twitter, Yandex, and Mediafire) for command and control communications.[1][4]
